name: John C. Mitchell
content: John Mitchell Home Page John C. Mitchell Mary and Gordon Crary Family Professor Professor of Computer Science and (by courtesy) Electrical Engineering and Education Research Interests Programming languages, computer security and privacy, blockchain, machine learning, collaborative learning and technology for education. Previously Stanford Vice Provost for Online Learing, Vice Provost for Teaching and Learning, and Chair, Department of Computer Science. (Pre-2012 web page) B.S. Stanford University; M.S., Ph.D. MIT. Research Program (partially updated) Publications: Google Scholar; Older list Research Projects Web security (subsuming older Phishing and online identity theft page) Network security: Model-checking security protocols, Protocol Composition Logic CourseWare, supporting the social networks of students and instructors with fine-grained access to information HIPAA and Healthcare privacy policy conformance web demo TRUST NSF Science and Technology Center Stanford Computer Security Lab Stanford Lytics Lab (active 2012-2018) Stanford Carta Lab and Carta Platform Stanford Pathways Lab Students (current graduate students and alumni) Books Concepts in Programming Languages (Cambridge Univ Press, 2002) Foundations for Programming Languages (MIT Press, 1996) Theoretical Aspects of Object-Oriented Programming (MIT Press, 1994) Professional Activities Journal of Computer Security, IOS Press site Stanford site Computing Community Consortium Courses and Departmental Activities Director of Graduate Studies; Former Director, Stanford Computer Forum Stanford courses Stanford Center for Professional Development: Computer Security Certificate Program Exam information for PhD students (Programming Language section of Comp, Qual) Information for visitors to Stanford CSD John C.
